articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Kumkop General Foodstuff Factory for Sportspersons
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Kumkop General Foodstuff Factory for Sportspersons
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first Secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the Kumkop General Foodstuff Factory for Sportspersons which has been modernized on the highest level. 
					 Saying that the factory underwent complete change in its appearance, he toured the newly-arranged room for education in the revolutionary history and room dedicated to the history of the factory.
					
					 He recalled with deep emotion the course of the development of the factory built under the great loving care of leader Kim Jong Il, saying: I feel deep yearning for the leader who said he would visit the factory, very pleased to hear the news about the completion of its construction. It would have been very glad to see him visit this modernly renovated factory. 
					
					 Then he went round different parts of the factory to learn in detail about its modernization and production and variety and quality of products.
					
					 The factory has been updated on the highest level, he said, adding what pleases him in particular is that its production processes have been put on a highly intensive basis.
					
					 Much wisdom and efforts were paid to turn it into a manpower- and energy-saving factory, he noted.
					
					 The factory has mass-produced various kinds of foodstuff needed for sportspersons' nutrition care and recovery from fatigue and other goods popular among citizens and achieved a great success in developing new products and its commodity designs and packing are admirable, he said. 
					
					 The success in every undertaking entirely depends on the role of officials, he said, repeatedly praising the officials of relevant field and the factory for having devoted their wisdom and zeal to the implementation of the Party's policies.
					
					 He expressed belief that the officials and employees of the factory would play the vanguard role in developing the nation's food industry. 
					
					 Accompanying him were Choe Ryong Hae, An Jong Su, Jo Yong Won and Kim Yo Jong.

articles.title: State Commendations Awarded to Persons of Distinguished Services
articles.content:
State Commendations Awarded to Persons of Distinguished Services
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- State commendations were awarded to the officials, scientists, technicians and workers who performed labor feats in the project for constructing the Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station No. 1 and No. 2.
					 The Order of Kim Il Sung went to Pak Chan Yong, the title of DPRK labor hero to 36 persons such as Ri Hang Jun and Kim Sang Min, Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize to 43 persons and Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize to 42.
					
					 The title of Merited Designer was awarded to three persons, title of Merited Scientist to one person, title of Merited Builder to 4 persons, title of Merited Driver to 5 persons, Order of National Flag First Class to 169 persons, Order of Labour to 76 persons, Order of National Flag Second Class to 1,169 persons, Order of National Flag Third Class to 2,607 persons, Distinguished Military Service Medal to 6 persons and Medal of Merit to 3,285 persons.
					
					 The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly issued a relevant decree on Jan. 6.

articles.title: Builders of Power Station Awarded Commemorative Medal
articles.content:
Builders of Power Station Awarded Commemorative Medal
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station Construction Commemorative Medal was awarded to 12 931 persons including officials, officers and members of the youth shock brigade and builders who participated in the  construction of the Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station No. 1 and No. 2.
					 The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly issued a relevant decree on Jan. 6.

articles.title: International and National Games to Be Held in 2016
articles.content:
International and National Games to Be Held in 2016
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- A number of international and national sports contests are to be held in the DPRK in Juche 105 (2016).
					 The international contests include the 24th Paektusan Prize International Figure Skating Festival to be held here in February in celebration of the Day of the Shining Star and the IAAF-28th Mangyongdae Prize Marathon in April to celebrate the Day of the Sun.
					
					 The GAC group 2016 ITTF World Tour Challenge Series-Pyongyang Open is also slated for June and July.
					
					 Among the national games for this year are the Paektusan Prize Sports Games (February), Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games (March-April), the Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize (June), Sports Contest for Songun Torch Prize (June), Sports Contest for Jonsung Cup (July), the Osandok Prize Sports Contest (December) scheduled to be held in Pyongyang, Hamhung, Phyongsong, Sariwon and Samjiyon, etc.
					
					 In particular, the 13th People's Games is expected to be the biggest one among those domestic sports games.
					
					 Besides, in the intervals of those big games are the national youth championship, the national juvenile championship, the 53rd National Games of Juvenile Sports Schools, the men's premier soccer league for Torch Cup, the women's premier soccer league for celebrating the founding anniversary of the DPRK (September 9), cross-country relays, indoor athletic championship, national contest of university basketball teams and so on.

articles.title: People's Open-air Ice Rink Crowded with Visitors
articles.content:
People's Open-air Ice Rink Crowded with Visitors
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The People's Open-air Ice Rink, located on the bank of the Taedong River in Pyongyang, is bustling with schoolchildren who are on winter vacation.
					 According to Ji Tong Il, chief engineer of the ice rink, more than 1,000 schoolchildren and their parents enjoy skating at the rink on holidays and Sundays.
					
					 Freezing cold continues for several days, but the rink is always crowded with visitors.
					
					 Paek Hyang Wi, a student of the Ryusong Junior Secondary School in Central District, said:
					
					 I frequent here with my classmates during this vacation. Whenever I come here, I feel refreshed. This splendid ice rink was built for us thanks to the love of the Workers' Party of Korea for the people and younger generation. It makes me feel boundless gratitude to the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Preserving Peace Is Fundamental to Achieving Country's Reunification: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Preserving Peace Is Fundamental to Achieving Country's Reunification: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- It is an urgent demand under the prevailing situation to turn the Korean Peninsula into a lasting peace zone free from  a war and achieve the country's reunification by concerted efforts in the spirit  of By Our Nation Itself under the peaceful circumstance, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 To ensure peace and stability in the peninsula is a crucial matter related to the existence of the Korean nation and the country's reunification. 
					
					 It is an exercise of the legitimate right by the DPRK to firmly protect peace in the peninsula and nation's security from the U.S. horrible nuclear threat and blackmail and steadily bolster up its nuclear deterrent for achieving peaceful reunification. No one is allowed to take issue with it. 
					
					 It is necessary to build one's own powerful military deterrent and bolster it up in every way. This is the only way of ensuring peace in the world, protecting the Korean nation's sovereignty and vital rights and paving avenue to peaceful reunification under the present situation where the imperialist aggressor forces are making no scruple of imposing war and disaster upon other countries and nations through their high-handed military actions. 
					
					 The U.S. is getting more frantic in its moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK.
					
					 No provocation of the U.S. can ever browbeat the army and people of the DPRK. On the contrary it will compel the latter to bolster up its self-defensive nuclear deterrent.
					
					 The DPRK will carry on a more dynamic struggle to resolutely meet the challenges of hostile forces under the banner of preserving peace, firmly defend the nation's sovereignty and security and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: KCNA Urges U.S. to Withdraw Its Troops from S. Korea
articles.content:
KCNA Urges U.S. to Withdraw Its Troops from S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The Canadian Institute for World Studies posted on its website an article on Jan. 11 disclosing the thrice-cursed war crimes such as indiscriminate bombing and use of biochemical weapons committed by the U.S. during the Korean War.
					 Recalling that the DPRK has been exposed to the U.S. sanctions, pressure and threat of aggression for the last several decades after the war, the article noted that the U.S. imperialist aggressive policy is, indeed, a factor of threatening peace in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world.
					
					 The U.S. is the aggressor and provocateur who has brought all sorts of misfortune and disasters to the Korean people.
					
					 Clark, commander of the "UN Forces" in the closing period of the Korean War, conducted operations to destroy, burn and kill everything, blustering that he would completely erase 78 cities of north Korea on the map in order to reduce it to debris.
					
					 U.S. planes dropped at least 428,000 bombs over Pyongyang alone more than its population, turning it into debris. During the whole period of the war, flying corps of the U.S. air force made more than 800,000 sorties and those of the marines and navy over 250,000 sorties, dropping nearly 600,000 tons of bombs or 3.7 times those it dropped over the land of Japan during the Pacific War. That meant 18 bombs per one square kilometer.
					
					 The U.S. also waged germ warfare and chemical warfare against all areas of the DPRK.
					
					 Its hundreds of planes made a total of 804 sorties to drop all types of germ bombs over 169 areas of the DPRK in the period from early January to March, 1952.
					
					 It used chemical weapons prohibited by the international convention in cities, counties and frontline areas of the DPRK from Feb. 1951 to July, 1953. It had massively sprayed poisonous gas since its indiscriminate air raids over Nampho City in May, 1951.
					
					 It has intentionally and periodically escalated the tension in the Korean Peninsula over the past several decades after the war.
					
					 Asserting that the U.S. suffered a heavy defeat in the Korean War as it did not use A-bomb," it shaped nuclear war scenarios calling for the use of nuclear weapons in case of the outbreak of the second Korean War. 
					
					 The number of the nuclear weapons introduced and deployed by the U.S. in south Korea steadily increased. It reached more than 1,000 in the 1970s and over 1,720 in the 1990s, turning south Korea into the biggest arsenal of nuclear weapons in the world.
					
					 The U.S. has staged north-targeted nuclear war exercises under various codenames after massively introducing nuclear strike means such as a super-large nuclear carrier, Aegis destroyer and nuclear submarine, painting them as "defensive and annual ones." 
					
					 In order to improve the maneuverability and offensive capability of the U.S. forces present in south Korea, the U.S. has steadily increased the number and scale of all forms of military exercises under the pretext of coping with the so-called "provocation" and "nuclear threat" from the north. It is thus leading the situation to the brink of a war. 
					
					 The U.S. forces' presence in south Korea has not only turned the Korean Peninsula into the hottest spot but also posed a serious threat to peace and security in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 Their withdrawal from south Korea is the urgent requirement of the times aspiring after durable peace and prosperity in the Korean Peninsula and Northeast Asia.
					
					 The U.S. should put an end to its war actions by pulling its troops out of south Korea as soon as possible.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Group Accused of Shielding Man-killers in Ryongsan
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Group Accused of Shielding Man-killers in Ryongsan
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- An editorial denouncing the south Korean conservative regime for shielding those who caused Ryongsan disaster was posted on Voice of People, the south Korean internet paper, on Jan. 21.
					 The editorial recalled that evacuees in Ryongsan staged an action on the top of a building and five of them were ruthlessly killed, a disaster caused by the police's indiscriminate suppression.
					
					 It deplored that Kim Sok Gi, the then director of the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency, went unpunished.

articles.title: Day of Sun and Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in DR Congo
articles.content:
Day of Sun and Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in DR Congo
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of DR Congo for celebrating the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star (birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il) was formed in Kinshasa on January 16. 
					 Andre Lohekele Kalonda, chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee. 
					
					 The committee decided to significantly hold political and cultural events praising the revolutionary careers and exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il from January 20 to April 15.

articles.title: H-bomb Test of DPRK Hailed by Russian Newspaper
articles.content:
H-bomb Test of DPRK Hailed by Russian Newspaper 
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The first issue of Pravda Primoriya, the organ of the  Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, carried several articles illustrated with the photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un looking round the successfully built Sci-Tech Complex. 
					 The article titled "Sci-Tech Complex in Pyongyang" conveyed an account of the ceremony of the completion of the Sci-Tech Complex held in the presence of Kim Jong Un on Jan. 1. 
					
					 Another article titled "H-bomb is weapon for self-defence" said that the DPRK is drawing great attention from the world through its successful H-bomb test. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 After the DPRK government issued its statement, leader Kim Jong Un declared once again that the H-bomb test was a self-defensive measure to cope with the danger of a nuclear war posed by the U.S. and its followers. 
					
					 The DPRK has in place a strong shield to beat back the U.S. aggression by developing nuclear weapons by itself.
					
					 The DPRK has already suffered from sanctions for several decades. 
					
					 However, sanctions will never deter the DPRK from advancing along the road of socialism chosen by itself.

articles.title: DPRK's H-bomb Test Hailed by Brazilian Personage
articles.content:
DPRK's H-bomb Test Hailed by Brazilian Personage
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Rosanita Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, dedicated an article titled "DPRK's H-bomb test is exercise of legitimate right to cope with the U.S. nuclear blackmail" to the January 15-18 issue of the Brazilian paper Hora do Povo. 
					 Noting that the U.S. is displeased with the wide publicity of news of the first successful test of H-bomb worldwide, the article went on:
					
					 The U.S. is dismissing as a lie the fact that socialist Korea bolstered its nuclear deterrence by succeeding in the H-bomb test by its own efforts and with its indigenous technology.
					
					 This is because that the U.S. does not want to recognize the DPRK as one of a few countries possessed of H-bomb and carrier rockets. 
					
					 But the world progressives are extending support to the Korean people all out to protect the sovereignty and dignity of the country, hailing the H-bomb test as a just measure to cope with the U.S. nuclear blackmail and hostile policy towards the DPRK. 
					
					 Explicitly speaking, the DPRK's access to nuclear weapons was caused by the U.S. escalating nuclear threat and blackmail against it. 
					
					 The U.S. should respond to the DPRK's proposal for replacing the Armistice Agreement by a peace treaty.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers' Military Drills Slammed by British Organization
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers' Military Drills Slammed by British Organization
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its website on Jan. 12 an article assailing the south Korean military warmongers' saber-rattling.
					 The article said:
					
					 The south Korean military warmongers are getting frantic with the north-targeted war exercises from the very outset of the new year.
					
					 They conducted a joint military exercise of the three services of south Korea with various types of military hardware such as F-15K and Aegis destroyer involved on January 1.
					
					 The chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff toured waters off the hottest spot in the West Sea of Korea aboard Aegis destroyer, agitating invasion of the north.
					
					 On the same day, warmongers belonging to the 2nd Corps of the Army were busy with artillery firing drill, talking about the "enemy's provocation." Various types of helicopters, tanks and armored cars of the air operation command of the Army and the 11th motorized infantry division were also busy in firing shells at a shooting range in Yangphyong, Kyonggi Province.
					
					 The reality proves that the south Korean authorities are disturbing peace and stability in the Korean Peninsula and blocking the reunification of Korea.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported by Egyptian Political Parties
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported by Egyptian Political Parties
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- There took place a joint meeting of Egyptian political parties in Cairo on January 17 to voice solidarity to the struggle of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people. 
					 On display at the venue of the meeting were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Leaders and members of more than 10 Egyptian political parties were present and the DPRK ambassador to Egypt and staff members of his embassy were present on invitation. 
					
					 Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, vice-chairman of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt and chairman of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association, referred to the validity and invincible vitality of the Songun idea fathered and developed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, and the DPRK's successful first H-bomb test and its historical significance. 
					
					 Speakers said at the meeting that the DPRK's successful first H-bomb test marked a great event which changed the balance of forces in the world where the U.S. goes reckless as it pleases and a just measure making a substantial contribution to protecting security and peace in the world, instilling great confidence and courage into the world progressives including Egyptians.

articles.title: DPRK's H-Bomb Test Supported by Russian Newspaper
articles.content:
DPRK's H-Bomb Test Supported by Russian Newspaper
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The second issue of the Russian newspaper Zavtra carried an article titled "Congratulations" written by its Editor-in-Chief Alexandr Prokhanov on the DPRK's successful first H-bomb test.
					 The paper said:
					
					 The fact that the people of the DPRK, small as it is, acquired the capability to develop H-bomb goes to prove their greatness.
					
					 The Korean people are persistently working hard to boost their country's might.
					
					 The threats of the U.S., Japan and south Korea are touching off bitter hatred and resentment among them.
					
					 The world should understand and judge their resentment.
					
					 The Korean people have their own mode of existence handed down generation after generation.
					
					 The DPRK's access to H-bomb does not pose any "threat" to peace but reminds the world that the idea of serving the purposes of justice and conscience and best dream can work miracles.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Austria
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Austria
 Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of Austria for celebrating the Day of the Sun and the Day of Shining Star (birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il) was formed in Vienna on January 18. 
					 Thomas Losh, secretary general of the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK and chief of the Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee. 
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to hold multifarious political and cultural events in praise of the revolutionary careers and feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita Combinado de Alimentos Kumkop para Deportistas
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita Combinado de Alimentos Kumkop para Deportistas
Pyongyang, 23 de enero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno el Combinado de Alimentos Kumkop para Deportistas, modernizado en el mas alto nivel.
					Contemplando el panorama del combinado nuevamente remodelado, el Mariscal dijo que se ha cambiado radicalmente su fisonomia imposibilitando buscar su aspecto anterior.
					
					Primero, estuvo en la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria y la otra de presentacion del historial, acondicionadas nuevamente.
					
					Recordando con profunda emocion la trayectoria del desarrollo del combinado levantado gracias al gran amor del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, senalo que le toca mas profundamente el aspecto del Dirigente quien queria venir aqui expresando gran satisfaccion al recibir el parte de la culminacion de la obra del combinado. Y anadio que estarian muy alegres si tuvieran la oportunidad de mostrar al Dirigente el combinado modernamente remodelado.
					
					Recorrio varios lugares de la fabrica averiguando detalles del estado de modernizacion y produccion, de las variedades y calidades de sus productos.
					
					Se realizo en nivel maximo la modernizacion, dijo y continuo que lo que le gusta mas es los procesos productivos mas intensivos.  
					
					Subrayo que puede percibir que han hecho tenaces esfuerzos por transformar el combinado en la fabrica de tipo economico en manos de obra y energia incluyendo la instalacion de transportador deslizadero, inventado originalmente en el proceso de envio de mercancias.
					
					Acoto que el combinado produce en gran cantidad varios alimentos favorables al mantenimiento nutritivo y el alivio de fatiga de los deportistas y los articulos afamados por los habitantes, obtiene notables exitos en el desarrollo de nuevos productos y hace bien el diseno y el embalaje de las mercancias. 
					
					Elogio reiteradamente a los meritos de los funcionarios de la rama relacionada y del combinado quienes dedican toda su inteligencia y entusiasmo a la materializacion de la politica del partido aseverando que la llave de los exitos de todas las labores esta enteramente en la mano de los funcionarios.
					
					Manifesto su esperanza y conviccion de que los funcionarios y empleados del combinado cumpliran con su papel vanguardista en el desarrollo de la industria alimentaria del pais.
					
					Le acompanaron en la ocasion Choe Ryong Hae, An Jong Su, Jo Yong Won y Kim Yo Jong.

articles.title: Condecorados ameritados en construccion de Central Hidroelectrica Heroes Jovenes Paektusan
articles.content:
Condecorados ameritados en construccion de Central Hidroelectrica Heroes Jovenes Paektusan
Pyongyang, 23 de enero (ACNC) -- Fueron condecorados en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea los funcionarios, miembros directivos e integrantes de la brigada juvenil, constructores, funcionarios, cientificos, tecnicos y obreros de las unidades relacionadas quienes realizaron meritos  laborales en la construccion de las Centrales Hidroelectricas Heroes Jovenes Paektusan no. 1 y no.2
					La Orden Kim Il Sung fue concedida a Pak Chan Yong; el titulo de Heroe del Trabajo a Ri Hang Jun, Kim Sang Min y otras 34 personas; el Premio de Honor Juvenil Kim Il Sung a 43 y el Premio de Honor Juvenil Kim Jong Il a 42.
					
					El titulo de Disenador Benemerito fue otorgado a 3 personas; el de Cientifico Benemerito a 1; el de Constructor Benemerito a 4; el de Chofer Benemerito a 5; la Orden Bandera Nacional de primera clase a 169; la Orden del Trabajo a 76; la Orden Bandera Nacional de segunda clase a mil 169; la Orden Bandera Nacional de tercera clase a 2 mil 607; la Medalla del Merito Militar a 6; y la Medalla del Merito Laboral a 3 mil 285.
					
					Se publico el dia 6 un decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC.

articles.title: Medalla conmemorativa a constructores de Central Hidroelectrica Heroes Jovenes Paektusan
articles.content:
Medalla conmemorativa a constructores de Central Hidroelectrica Heroes Jovenes Paektusan
Pyongyang, 23 de enero (ACNC) -- En la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fue otorgada la medalla conmemorativa de construccion de la Central Hidroelectrica Heroes Jovenes Paektusan a 12 mil 931 funcionarios, miembros directivos e integrantes de la brigada juvenil y constructores participantes en la construccion de las centrales no.1 y no. 2. 
					Quedo publicado el dia 6 un decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC.

articles.title: Competencias nacionales e internacionales previstas en RPDC
articles.content:
Competencias nacionales e internacionales previstas en RPDC
Pyongyang, 23 de enero (ACNC) -- Este ano tendran lugar las competencias nacionales e internacionales y los festivales y los juegos deportivos en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Con motivo del Dia de la Estrella Luz (16 de febrero) y el Dia del Sol (15 de abril), se efectuaran en esta capital el XXIV Festival Internacional de Patinaje Artistico sobre el Hielo por el Premio Paektusan y el XXVIII Torneo Internacional de Maraton para el Premio Mangyongdae como evento concurrente de la Federacion Internacional de Atletas Amateurs (FIAA). 
					
					Al igual que el ano expirado, esta prevista en junio y julio la competencia abierta de ping pong de Pyongyang en el marco del Giro Mundial de la ITTF 2016.
					
					Bajo la profunda atencion de los aficionados al deporte, se efectuaran en las regiones como Pyongyang, Hamhung, Phyongsong, Sariwon y Samjiyon los juegos nacionales inclusive la competencia deportiva por el premio Paektusan (febrero), la otra por el premio Mangyongdae (marzo-abril), la otra por la copa Antorcha de Pochonbo (junio), la otra por la copa Antorcha de Songun (junio), la otra por la Copa Jonsung (julio) y la otra por el Premio Osandok (diciembre).
					
					Particularmente, se realizara solemnemente la XIII competencia deportiva del pueblo.
					
					Se ejecutaran el campeonato de jovenes, el campeonato de juniores, la 53a competencia deportiva nacional de las escuelas deportivas de jovenes y ninos, el torneo de futbol de primera categoria, el torneo de futbol femenino de primera clase en conmemoracion de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, la carrera de relevos en montanas y llanuras, el campeonato de atletismo bajo techo y la competencia nacional de basquetbol de los conjuntos deportivos de las universidades.
					
					Se desarrollaran, ademas, la competencia de basquetbol de los equipos poderosos, la competencia nacional de fuertes pesistas y el reto de Sirum, los cuales haran aporte al desarrollo de la tecnica deportiva del pais.
